holoviews.plotting PackageÂ¶

plotting PackageÂ¶

class holoviews.plotting.PlotSaver(**params)[source]Â¶

Bases: param.parameterized.ParameterizedFunction

params(anim_opts=Dict, filename=String, size=NumericTuple, name=String)

Parameterized function for saving the plot of a ViewableElement object to disk either as a static figure or as an animation. Keywords that are not parameters are passed into the anim method of the appropriate plot for animations and into matplotlib.figure.savefig for static figures.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Mode [0m

anim_opts {‘.gif’: ({‘fps’: 10}, []), ‘.webm’: ... Dict V RW filename None String V RW AN size (5, 5) NumericTuple V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34manim_opts: The arguments to matplotlib.animation.save for different[0m [1;34m animation formats. The key is the file extension and the tuple[0m [1;34m consists of the kwargs followed by a list of arguments for the[0m [1;34m ‘extra_args’ keyword argument.[0m [1;31mfilename: This is the filename of the saved file. The output file type[0m [1;31m will be inferred from the file extension.[0m [1;34msize: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m

param Dict anim_opts (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={‘.gif’: ({‘fps’: 10}, []), ‘.webm’: ({}, [‘-vcodec’, ‘libvpx’, ‘-b’, ‘1000k’]), ‘.mp4’: ({‘codec’: ‘libx264’}, [‘-pix_fmt’, ‘yuv420p’])}, instantiate=True, is_instance=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The arguments to matplotlib.animation.save for different animation formats. The key is the file extension and the tuple consists of the kwargs followed by a list of arguments for the ‘extra_args’ keyword argument.
param String filename (allow_None=True, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
This is the filename of the saved file. The output file type will be inferred from the file extension.
param NumericTuple size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(5, 5), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388345d0>Â¶
get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Same as Parameterized.script_repr, except that X.classname(Y is replaced with X.classname.instance(Y

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834628>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388347e0>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.TextPlot(annotation, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.annotation.AnnotationPlot

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

apply_databounds True Boolean (0, 1) V RW aspect ‘square’ Parameter V RW figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW orientation ‘horizontal’ ObjectSelector V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW rescale_individually False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_frame True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_grid False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_xaxis ‘bottom’ ObjectSelector V RW show_yaxis ‘left’ ObjectSelector V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW xticks 5 Integer V RW yticks 5 Integer V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31maspect: The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may[0m [1;31m select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may[0m [1;31m be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display[0m [1;31m the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and[0m [1;31m ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in[0m [1;31m matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.[0m [1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;31m for nested data containers.[0m [1;34morientation: The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not[0m [1;34m always be respected by all plots but should be respected by[0m [1;34m adjoined plots when appropriate.[0m [1;31mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;31m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;34mrescale_individually: Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.[0m [1;31mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_grid: Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.[0m [1;31mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;34mshow_xaxis: Whether and where to display the xaxis.[0m [1;31mshow_yaxis: Whether and where to display the yaxis.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;34mxticks: Number of ticks along the x-axis.[0m [1;31myticks: Number of ticks along the y-axis.[0m

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834680>Â¶
get_extents(view, ranges)Â¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834470>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.Plot(figure=None, axis=None, dimensions=None, layout_dimensions=None, subplots=None, uniform=True, keys=None, subplot=False, **params)Â¶

Bases: param.parameterized.Parameterized

params(figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

A Plot object returns either a matplotlib figure object (when called or indexed) or a matplotlib animation object as appropriate. Plots take element objects such as Matrix, Contours or Points as inputs and plots them in the appropriate format. As views may vary over time, all plots support animation via the anim() method.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW show_frame True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;31m for nested data containers.[0m [1;34mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;34m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;31mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;31msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;34mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Updates the current frame of the plot.

update_handles(axis, view, key, ranges=None)Â¶

Should be called by the update_frame class to update any handles on the plot.

warning(*args)Â¶

class holoviews.plotting.SurfacePlot(element, keys=None, ranges=None, dimensions=None, overlaid=False, cyclic_index=0, zorder=0, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.chart3d.Plot3D

params(plot_type=ObjectSelector, azimuth=Integer, distance=Integer, elevation=Integer, apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

Plots surfaces wireframes and contours in 3D space. Provides options to switch the display type via the plot_type parameter has support for a number of styling options including strides and colors.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

apply_databounds False Boolean (0, 1) V RW aspect ‘square’ Parameter V RW azimuth -60 Integer (-90, 90) V RW distance 10 Integer (7, 15) V RW elevation 30 Integer (0, 180) V RW figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW orientation ‘horizontal’ ObjectSelector V RW plot_type ‘surface’ ObjectSelector V RW projection ‘3d’ ObjectSelector V RW rescale_individually False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_frame False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_grid False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_xaxis ‘fixed’ ObjectSelector V RW show_yaxis ‘fixed’ ObjectSelector V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW xticks 5 Integer V RW yticks 5 Integer V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31maspect: The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may[0m [1;31m select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may[0m [1;31m be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display[0m [1;31m the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and[0m [1;31m ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in[0m [1;31m matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.[0m [1;34mazimuth: Azimuth angle in the x,y plane.[0m [1;31mdistance: Distance from the plotted object.[0m [1;34melevation: Elevation angle in the z-axis.[0m [1;31mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;31m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;31m around the subplots.[0m [1;34mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;31mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;31m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;31m displayed object.[0m [1;34mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;34m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;34m for nested data containers.[0m [1;31morientation: The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not[0m [1;31m always be respected by all plots but should be respected by[0m [1;31m adjoined plots when appropriate.[0m [1;34mplot_type: Specifies the type of visualization for the Surface object.[0m [1;31mprojection: The projection of the matplotlib axis.[0m [1;34mrescale_individually: Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.[0m [1;31mshow_frame: Whether to draw a frame around the figure.[0m [1;34mshow_grid: Whether to draw a grid in the figure.[0m [1;31mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;34mshow_xaxis: Whether and where to display the xaxis.[0m [1;31mshow_yaxis: Whether and where to display the yaxis.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;34mxticks: Number of ticks along the x-axis.[0m [1;31myticks: Number of ticks along the y-axis.[0m

param ObjectSelector plot_type (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=surface, instantiate=False, objects=[‘surface’, ‘wireframe’, ‘contour’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Specifies the type of visualization for the Surface object.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=False, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=3d, instantiate=False, objects=[], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the matplotlib axis.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=fixed, instantiate=False, objects=[‘fixed’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to draw a frame around the figure.
param Integer elevation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 180), constant=False, default=30, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Elevation angle in the z-axis.
param Integer azimuth (allow_None=False, bounds=(-90, 90), constant=False, default=-60, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Azimuth angle in the x,y plane.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to draw a grid in the figure.
param Integer distance (allow_None=False, bounds=(7, 15), constant=False, default=10, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Distance from the plotted object.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=fixed, instantiate=False, objects=[‘fixed’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834578>Â¶
get_extents(view, ranges)Â¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834418>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388345d0>Â¶
message(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834680>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388344c8>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(*args, **kwargs)Â¶

If on the bottom Layer, clear plot before drawing each frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

class holoviews.plotting.CurvePlot(data, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.chart.ChartPlot

params(autotick=Boolean, center_cyclic=Boolean, num_ticks=Integer, relative_labels=Boolean, show_legend=Boolean, log_x=Boolean, log_y=Boolean, apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

CurvePlot can plot Curve and ViewMaps of Curve, which can be displayed as a single frame or animation. Axes, titles and legends are automatically generated from dim_info.

If the dimension is set to cyclic in the dim_info it will rotate the curve so that minimum y values are at the minimum x value to make the plots easier to interpret.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

apply_databounds True Boolean (0, 1) V RW aspect ‘square’ Parameter V RW autotick False Boolean (0, 1) V RW center_cyclic True Boolean (0, 1) V RW figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW log_x False Boolean (0, 1) V RW log_y False Boolean (0, 1) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW num_ticks 5 Integer V RW orientation ‘horizontal’ ObjectSelector V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW relative_labels False Boolean (0, 1) V RW rescale_individually False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_frame False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_grid True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_legend True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_xaxis ‘bottom’ ObjectSelector V RW show_yaxis ‘left’ ObjectSelector V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW xticks 5 Integer V RW yticks 5 Integer V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31maspect: The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may[0m [1;31m select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may[0m [1;31m be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display[0m [1;31m the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and[0m [1;31m ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in[0m [1;31m matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.[0m [1;34mautotick: Whether to let matplotlib automatically compute tick marks[0m [1;34m or to allow the user to control tick marks.[0m [1;31mcenter_cyclic: If enabled and plotted quantity is cyclic will center the[0m [1;31m plot around the peak.[0m [1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mlog_x: Whether to apply log scaling to the x-axis of the Chart.[0m [1;34mlog_y: Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;31m for nested data containers.[0m [1;34mnum_ticks: If autotick is disabled, this number of tickmarks will be drawn.[0m [1;31morientation: The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not[0m [1;31m always be respected by all plots but should be respected by[0m [1;31m adjoined plots when appropriate.[0m [1;34mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;34m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;31mrelative_labels: If plotted quantity is cyclic and center_cyclic is enabled,[0m [1;31m will compute tick labels relative to the center.[0m [1;34mrescale_individually: Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.[0m [1;31mshow_frame: Disabled by default for clarity.[0m [1;34mshow_grid: Enable axis grid.[0m [1;31mshow_legend: Whether to show legend for the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;31mshow_xaxis: Whether and where to display the xaxis.[0m [1;34mshow_yaxis: Whether and where to display the yaxis.[0m [1;31msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;34mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;31mxticks: Number of ticks along the x-axis.[0m [1;34myticks: Number of ticks along the y-axis.[0m

param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean relative_labels (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
If plotted quantity is cyclic and center_cyclic is enabled, will compute tick labels relative to the center.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Boolean autotick (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to let matplotlib automatically compute tick marks or to allow the user to control tick marks.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Integer num_ticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
If autotick is disabled, this number of tickmarks will be drawn.
param Boolean log_x (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the x-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Disabled by default for clarity.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Enable axis grid.
param Boolean log_y (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean show_legend (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show legend for the plot.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Boolean center_cyclic (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
If enabled and plotted quantity is cyclic will center the plot around the peak.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388346d8>Â¶
get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834578>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834680>Â¶
message(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388344c8>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834788>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834680>Â¶
get_extents(view, ranges)Â¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

update_handles(axis, view, key, ranges=None)Â¶

Update the elements of the plot. :param axis:

class holoviews.plotting.MatrixGridPlot(layout, keys=None, dimensions=None, ranges=None, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.GridPlot, holoviews.plotting.element.OverlayPlot

params(border=Number, tick_format=String, show_legend=Boolean, apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

MatrixGridPlot evenly spaces out plots of individual projections on a grid, even when they differ in size. Since this class uses a single axis to generate all the individual plots it is much faster than the equivalent using subplots.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

apply_databounds True Boolean (0, 1) V RW aspect ‘square’ Parameter V RW border 10 Number V RW figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW orientation ‘horizontal’ ObjectSelector V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW rescale_individually False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_frame False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_grid False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_legend False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_xaxis ‘bottom’ ObjectSelector V RW show_yaxis ‘left’ ObjectSelector V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW tick_format ‘%.2f’ String V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW xticks 5 Integer V RW yticks 5 Integer V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31maspect: The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may[0m [1;31m select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may[0m [1;31m be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display[0m [1;31m the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and[0m [1;31m ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in[0m [1;31m matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.[0m [1;34mborder: Aggregate border as a fraction of total plot size.[0m [1;31mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;31m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;31m around the subplots.[0m [1;34mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;31mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;31m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;31m displayed object.[0m [1;34mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;34m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;34m for nested data containers.[0m [1;31morientation: The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not[0m [1;31m always be respected by all plots but should be respected by[0m [1;31m adjoined plots when appropriate.[0m [1;34mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;34m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;31mrescale_individually: Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.[0m [1;34mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;31mshow_grid: Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_legend: Legends add to much clutter in a grid and are disabled by default.[0m [1;31mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;34mshow_xaxis: Whether and where to display the xaxis.[0m [1;31mshow_yaxis: Whether and where to display the yaxis.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31mtick_format: Formatting string for the GridPlot ticklabels.[0m [1;34mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;31mxticks: Number of ticks along the x-axis.[0m [1;34myticks: Number of ticks along the y-axis.[0m

param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Number border (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=10, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Aggregate border as a fraction of total plot size.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.
param String tick_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=%.2f, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Formatting string for the GridPlot ticklabels.
param Boolean show_legend (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Legends add to much clutter in a grid and are disabled by default.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834628>Â¶
get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834310>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388346d8>Â¶
message(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834788>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388347e0>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_handles(axis, view, key, ranges=None)Â¶

Should be called by the update_frame class to update any handles on the plot.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.CompositePlot(figure=None, axis=None, dimensions=None, layout_dimensions=None, subplots=None, uniform=True, keys=None, subplot=False, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.Plot

params(figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

CompositePlot provides a baseclass for plots coordinate multiple subplots to form a Layout.

anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834310>Â¶
get_extents(view, ranges)Â¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834680>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834788>Â¶
message(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388344c8>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388347e0>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.Plot3D(element, keys=None, ranges=None, dimensions=None, overlaid=False, cyclic_index=0, zorder=0, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.element.ElementPlot

Plot3D provides a common baseclass for mplot3d based plots.

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31maspect: The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may[0m [1;31m select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may[0m [1;31m be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display[0m [1;31m the plot as an element of a grid). param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=False, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=3d, instantiate=False, objects=[], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the matplotlib axis.

Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.

anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834310>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834730>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.ChartPlot(data, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.element.ElementPlot
