[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31maspect: The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may[0m [1;31m select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may[0m [1;31m be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display[0m [1;31m the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and[0m [1;31m ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in[0m [1;31m matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.[0m [1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mlog_x: Whether to apply log scaling to the x-axis of the Chart.[0m [1;34mlog_y: Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;31m for nested data containers.[0m [1;34morientation: The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not[0m [1;34m always be respected by all plots but should be respected by[0m [1;34m adjoined plots when appropriate.[0m [1;31mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;31m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;34mrescale_individually: Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.[0m [1;31mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_grid: Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.[0m [1;31mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;34mshow_xaxis: Whether and where to display the xaxis.[0m [1;31mshow_yaxis: Whether and where to display the yaxis.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;34mxticks: Number of ticks along the x-axis.[0m [1;31myticks: Number of ticks along the y-axis.[0m

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Boolean log_y (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean log_x (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the x-axis of the Chart.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834788>Â¶
get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834418>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834470>Â¶
message(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834680>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834368>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

update_handles(axis, view, key, ranges=None)Â¶

Update the elements of the plot. :param axis:

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.

Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.

param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388343c0>Â¶
get_extents(view, ranges)Â¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834628>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834730>Â¶

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834470>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388345d0>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.GridPlot(layout, ranges=None, keys=None, dimensions=None, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.CompositePlot

params(show_legend=Boolean, tick_format=String, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

Plot a group of elements in a grid layout based on a AxisLayout element object.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW show_frame True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_legend False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title False Boolean (0, 1) V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW tick_format ‘%.2f’ String V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;31m for nested data containers.[0m [1;34mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;34m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;31mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_legend: Legends add to much clutter in a grid and are disabled by default.[0m [1;31mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31mtick_format: Formatting string for the GridPlot ticklabels.[0m [1;34mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param String tick_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=%.2f, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Formatting string for the GridPlot ticklabels.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Boolean show_legend (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Legends add to much clutter in a grid and are disabled by default.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834730>Â¶
get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388344c8>Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834368>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834788>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_handles(axis, view, key, ranges=None)Â¶

Should be called by the update_frame class to update any handles on the plot.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.LayoutPlot(layout, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.CompositePlot

params(horizontal_spacing=Number, vertical_spacing=Number, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

A LayoutPlot accepts either a LayoutTree or a NdLayout and displays the elements in a cartesian grid in scanline order.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mhorizontal_spacing: Specifies the space between horizontally adjacent elements in the grid.[0m [1;31m Default value is set conservatively to avoid overlap of subplots.[0m [1;34mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;34m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;34m for nested data containers.[0m [1;31mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;31m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;34mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;31mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;34mvertical_spacing: Specifies the space between vertically adjacent elements in the grid.[0m [1;34m Default value is set conservatively to avoid overlap of subplots.[0m

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Number horizontal_spacing (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=0.5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Specifies the space between horizontally adjacent elements in the grid. Default value is set conservatively to avoid overlap of subplots.

Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.

Specifies the space between vertically adjacent elements in the grid. Default value is set conservatively to avoid overlap of subplots.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388343c0>Â¶
grid_situate(subplots, current_idx, layout_type, subgrid_width)Â¶

Situate the current AdjointLayoutPlot in a LayoutPlot. The LayoutPlot specifies a layout_type into which the AdjointLayoutPlot must be embedded. This enclosing layout is guaranteed to have enough cells to display all the views.

Based on this enforced layout format, a starting index supplied by LayoutPlot (indexing into a large gridspec arrangement) is updated to the appropriate embedded value. It will also return a list of gridspec indices associated with the all the required layout axes.

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31maspect: The aspect ratio mode of the plot. param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)

Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.VLinePlot(annotation, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.annotation.AnnotationPlot

params(apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String) Draw a vertical line on the axis [1;32mParameters of ‘VLinePlot’ ========================= [0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

apply_databounds True Boolean (0, 1) V RW aspect ‘square’ Parameter V RW figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW orientation ‘horizontal’ ObjectSelector V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW rescale_individually False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_frame True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_grid False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_xaxis ‘bottom’ ObjectSelector V RW show_yaxis ‘left’ ObjectSelector V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW xticks 5 Integer V RW yticks 5 Integer V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31maspect: The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may[0m [1;31m select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may[0m [1;31m be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display[0m [1;31m the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and[0m [1;31m ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in[0m [1;31m matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.[0m [1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;31m for nested data containers.[0m [1;34morientation: The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not[0m [1;34m always be respected by all plots but should be respected by[0m [1;34m adjoined plots when appropriate.[0m [1;31mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;31m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;34mrescale_individually: Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.[0m [1;31mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_grid: Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.[0m [1;31mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;34mshow_xaxis: Whether and where to display the xaxis.[0m [1;31mshow_yaxis: Whether and where to display the yaxis.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;34mxticks: Number of ticks along the x-axis.[0m [1;31myticks: Number of ticks along the y-axis.[0m

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834680>Â¶
get_extents(view, ranges)Â¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834628>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834470>Â¶
message(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388345d0>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834578>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

draw_annotation(annotation, position, opts)Â¶

Draw a horizontal line on the axis

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

class holoviews.plotting.Scatter3DPlot(data, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.chart3d.Plot3D, holoviews.plotting.chart.PointPlot

params(azimuth=Integer, distance=Integer, elevation=Integer, color_index=Integer, normalize_individually=Boolean, scaling_factor=Number, size_index=Integer, log_x=Boolean, log_y=Boolean, apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

Subclass of PointPlot allowing plotting of Points on a 3D axis, also allows mapping color and size onto a particular Dimension of the data.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

apply_databounds False Boolean (0, 1) V RW aspect ‘square’ Parameter V RW azimuth -60 Integer (-90, 90) V RW color_index 4 Integer V RW distance 10 Integer (7, 15) V RW elevation 30 Integer (0, 180) V RW figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW log_x False Boolean (0, 1) V RW log_y False Boolean (0, 1) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW normalize_individually False Boolean (0, 1) V RW orientation ‘horizontal’ ObjectSelector V RW projection ‘3d’ ObjectSelector V RW rescale_individually False Boolean (0, 1) V RW scaling_factor 1 Number (1, None) V RW show_frame False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_grid False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_xaxis ‘fixed’ ObjectSelector V RW show_yaxis ‘fixed’ ObjectSelector V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW size_index 3 Integer V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW xticks 5 Integer V RW yticks 5 Integer V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31maspect: The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may[0m [1;31m select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may[0m [1;31m be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display[0m [1;31m the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and[0m [1;31m ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in[0m [1;31m matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.[0m [1;34mazimuth: Azimuth angle in the x,y plane.[0m [1;31mcolor_index: Index of the dimension from which the color will the drawn[0m [1;34mdistance: Distance from the plotted object.[0m [1;31melevation: Elevation angle in the z-axis.[0m [1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mlog_x: Whether to apply log scaling to the x-axis of the Chart.[0m [1;34mlog_y: Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;31m for nested data containers.[0m [1;34mnormalize_individually: Whether to normalize the colors used to represent magnitude for[0m [1;34m each frame or across the map (when color is applicable).[0m [1;31morientation: The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not[0m [1;31m always be respected by all plots but should be respected by[0m [1;31m adjoined plots when appropriate.[0m [1;34mprojection: The projection of the matplotlib axis.[0m [1;31mrescale_individually: Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.[0m [1;34mscaling_factor: If values are supplied the area of the points is computed relative[0m [1;34m to the marker size. It is then multiplied by scaling_factor to the power[0m [1;34m of the ratio between the smallest point and all other points.[0m [1;34m For values of 1 scaling by the values is disabled, a factor of 2[0m [1;34m allows for linear scaling of the area and a factor of 4 linear[0m [1;34m scaling of the point width.[0m [1;31mshow_frame: Whether to draw a frame around the figure.[0m [1;34mshow_grid: Whether to draw a grid in the figure.[0m [1;31mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;34mshow_xaxis: Whether and where to display the xaxis.[0m [1;31mshow_yaxis: Whether and where to display the yaxis.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31msize_index: Index of the dimension from which the sizes will the drawn.[0m [1;34mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;31mxticks: Number of ticks along the x-axis.[0m [1;34myticks: Number of ticks along the y-axis.[0m

param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Integer color_index (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=4, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Index of the dimension from which the color will the drawn
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean normalize_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to normalize the colors used to represent magnitude for each frame or across the map (when color is applicable).
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Number scaling_factor (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, None), constant=False, default=1, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
If values are supplied the area of the points is computed relative to the marker size. It is then multiplied by scaling_factor to the power of the ratio between the smallest point and all other points. For values of 1 scaling by the values is disabled, a factor of 2 allows for linear scaling of the area and a factor of 4 linear scaling of the point width.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Integer size_index (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=3, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Index of the dimension from which the sizes will the drawn.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=False, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=3d, instantiate=False, objects=[], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the matplotlib axis.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=fixed, instantiate=False, objects=[‘fixed’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean log_x (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the x-axis of the Chart.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to draw a frame around the figure.
param Integer elevation (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 180), constant=False, default=30, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Elevation angle in the z-axis.
param Integer azimuth (allow_None=False, bounds=(-90, 90), constant=False, default=-60, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Azimuth angle in the x,y plane.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to draw a grid in the figure.
param Integer distance (allow_None=False, bounds=(7, 15), constant=False, default=10, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Distance from the plotted object.
param Boolean log_y (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to apply log scaling to the y-axis of the Chart.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=fixed, instantiate=False, objects=[‘fixed’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834310>Â¶
get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388346d8>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834418>Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834578>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388343c0>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(*args, **kwargs)Â¶

If on the bottom Layer, clear plot before drawing each frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.HistogramPlot(histograms, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.chart.ChartPlot

params(num_ticks=Integer, log_x=Boolean, log_y=Boolean, apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

HistogramPlot can plot DataHistograms and ViewMaps of DataHistograms, which can be displayed as a single frame or animation.

anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

state_push()Â¶

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

update_handles(axis, view, key, ranges=None)Â¶

Update the plot for an animation. :param axis:

class holoviews.plotting.VectorFieldPlot(*args, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.element.ElementPlot

params(arrow_heads=Boolean, color_dim=ObjectSelector, normalize_individually=Boolean, normalize_lengths=Boolean, apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

Renders vector fields in sheet coordinates. The vectors are expressed in polar coordinates and may be displayed according to angle alone (with some common, arbitrary arrow length) or may be true polar vectors.

Optionally, the arrows may be colored but this dimension is redundant with either the specified angle or magnitudes. This choice is made by setting the color_dim parameter.

Note that the ‘cmap’ style argument controls the color map used to color the arrows. The length of the arrows is controlled by the ‘scale’ style option where a value of 1.0 is such that the largest arrow shown is no bigger than the smallest sampling distance.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

apply_databounds True Boolean (0, 1) V RW arrow_heads True Boolean (0, 1) V RW aspect ‘square’ Parameter V RW color_dim None ObjectSelector V RW figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW normalize_individually False Boolean (0, 1) V RW normalize_lengths True Boolean (0, 1) V RW orientation ‘horizontal’ ObjectSelector V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW rescale_individually False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_frame True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_grid False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_xaxis ‘bottom’ ObjectSelector V RW show_yaxis ‘left’ ObjectSelector V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW xticks 5 Integer V RW yticks 5 Integer V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31marrow_heads: Whether or not to draw arrow heads. If arrowheads are enabled,[0m [1;31m they may be customized with the ‘headlength’ and[0m [1;31m ‘headaxislength’ style options.[0m [1;34maspect: The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may[0m [1;34m select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may[0m [1;34m be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display[0m [1;34m the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and[0m [1;34m ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in[0m [1;34m matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.[0m [1;31mcolor_dim: Which of the polar vector components is mapped to the color[0m [1;31m dimension (if any)[0m [1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;31m for nested data containers.[0m [1;34mnormalize_individually: Whether to normalize the colors used as an extra dimension[0m [1;34m per frame or across the map (when color is applicable).[0m [1;31mnormalize_lengths: Whether to normalize vector magnitudes automatically. If False,[0m [1;31m it will be assumed that the lengths have already been correctly[0m [1;31m normalized.[0m [1;34morientation: The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not[0m [1;34m always be respected by all plots but should be respected by[0m [1;34m adjoined plots when appropriate.[0m [1;31mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;31m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;34mrescale_individually: Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.[0m [1;31mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_grid: Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.[0m [1;31mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;34mshow_xaxis: Whether and where to display the xaxis.[0m [1;31mshow_yaxis: Whether and where to display the yaxis.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;34mxticks: Number of ticks along the x-axis.[0m [1;31myticks: Number of ticks along the y-axis.[0m

param ObjectSelector color_dim (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[u’angle’, u’magnitude’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Which of the polar vector components is mapped to the color dimension (if any)
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean normalize_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to normalize the colors used as an extra dimension per frame or across the map (when color is applicable).
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param Boolean arrow_heads (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to draw arrow heads. If arrowheads are enabled, they may be customized with the ‘headlength’ and ‘headaxislength’ style options.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param Boolean normalize_lengths (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to normalize vector magnitudes automatically. If False, it will be assumed that the lengths have already been correctly normalized.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388343c0>Â¶
get_extents(view, ranges)Â¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834578>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388346d8>Â¶
message(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b1538834310>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b15388345d0>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.AdjointLayoutPlot(layout, layout_type, subaxes, subplots, **params)Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.CompositePlot

params(border_size=Number, subplot_size=Number, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

LayoutPlot allows placing up to three Views in a number of predefined and fixed layouts, which are defined by the layout_dict class attribute. This allows placing subviews next to a main plot in either a ‘top’ or ‘right’ position.

Initially, a LayoutPlot computes an appropriate layout based for the number of Views in the AdjointLayout object it has been given, but when embedded in a NdLayout, it can recompute the layout to match the number of rows and columns as part of a larger grid.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

border_size 0.25 Number V RW figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW show_frame True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW subplot_size 0.25 Number V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW

param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)

param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
adjust_positions()Â¶

Make adjustments to the positions of subplots (if available) relative to the main plot axes as required.

This method is called by LayoutPlot after an initial pass used to position all the Layouts together. This method allows LayoutPlots to make final adjustments to the axis positions.

anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.
