Note that this parameter may not[0m [1;34m always be respected by all plots but should be respected by[0m [1;34m adjoined plots when appropriate.[0m [1;31mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;31m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;34mrescale_individually: Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.[0m [1;31mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_grid: Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.[0m [1;31mshow_legend: Whether to show legend for the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;31mshow_xaxis: Whether and where to display the xaxis.[0m [1;34mshow_yaxis: Whether and where to display the yaxis.[0m [1;31msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;34mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;31mxticks: Number of ticks along the x-axis.[0m [1;34myticks: Number of ticks along the y-axis.[0m

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param Boolean show_legend (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show legend for the plot.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

Update the elements of the plot. :param axis:

warning(*args)Â¶

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.hooks.PlottingHook(**params)[source]Â¶

Bases: param.parameterized.ParameterizedFunction

params(types=List, name=String)

PlottingHooks can be used to extend the default functionality of HoloViews. Each ElementPlot type can be provided with a list of hooks to apply at the end of plotting. The PlottingHook is provided with ElementPlot instance, which gives access to the figure, axis and artists via the handles, and the Element currently displayed by the Plot. Since each Plot can be associated with multiple Element plot types the Element types are validated against the Elements in the types parameter.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

types [] List (0, None) V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mtypes: List of types processed by the hook.[0m

param List types (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
List of types processed by the hook.

pandas ModuleÂ¶

class holoviews.plotting.pandas.DFrameViewPlot(view, **params)[source]Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.element.ElementPlot

params(plot_type=ObjectSelector, apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

DFramePlot provides a wrapper around Pandas dataframe plots. It takes a single DataFrameView or DFrameMap as input and plots it using the plotting command selected via the plot_type.

The plot_options specifies the valid options to be supplied to the selected plot_type via options.style_opts.

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.

Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.

param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

update_handles(axis, view, key, ranges=None)[source]Â¶

Update the plot for an animation.

plot ModuleÂ¶

class holoviews.plotting.plot.AdjointLayoutPlot(layout, layout_type, subaxes, subplots, **params)[source]Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.CompositePlot

params(border_size=Number, subplot_size=Number, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

LayoutPlot allows placing up to three Views in a number of predefined and fixed layouts, which are defined by the layout_dict class attribute. This allows placing subviews next to a main plot in either a ‘top’ or ‘right’ position.

Initially, a LayoutPlot computes an appropriate layout based for the number of Views in the AdjointLayout object it has been given, but when embedded in a NdLayout, it can recompute the layout to match the number of rows and columns as part of a larger grid.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

border_size 0.25 Number V RW figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW show_frame True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW subplot_size 0.25 Number V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mborder_size: The size of the border expressed as a fraction of the main plot.[0m [1;31mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;31m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;31m around the subplots.[0m [1;34mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;31mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;31m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;31m displayed object.[0m [1;34mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;34m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;34m for nested data containers.[0m [1;31mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;31m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;34mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;31mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31msubplot_size: The size subplots as expressed as a fraction of the main plot.[0m [1;34mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Number border_size (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=0.25, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
The size of the border expressed as a fraction of the main plot.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Number subplot_size (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=0.25, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
The size subplots as expressed as a fraction of the main plot.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
adjust_positions()[source]Â¶

Make adjustments to the positions of subplots (if available) relative to the main plot axes as required.

This method is called by LayoutPlot after an initial pass used to position all the Layouts together. This method allows LayoutPlots to make final adjustments to the axis positions.

anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e817680>Â¶
get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e817730>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e817628>Â¶
message(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e8176d8>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e817520>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_handles(axis, view, key, ranges=None)Â¶

Should be called by the update_frame class to update any handles on the plot.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.plot.CompositePlot(figure=None, axis=None, dimensions=None, layout_dimensions=None, subplots=None, uniform=True, keys=None, subplot=False, **params)[source]Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.Plot

params(figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

CompositePlot provides a baseclass for plots coordinate multiple subplots to form a Layout.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

class holoviews.plotting.plot.GridPlot(layout, ranges=None, keys=None, dimensions=None, **params)[source]Â¶

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)

param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)

Formatting string for the GridPlot ticklabels.

The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Boolean show_legend (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Legends add to much clutter in a grid and are disabled by default.

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. class holoviews.plotting.plot.LayoutPlot(layout, **params)[source]Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.CompositePlot

params(horizontal_spacing=Number, vertical_spacing=Number, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

A LayoutPlot accepts either a LayoutTree or a NdLayout and displays the elements in a cartesian grid in scanline order.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

figure_bounds (0.05, 0.05, 0.95, 0.95) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW horizontal_spacing 0.5 Number V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW show_frame True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW vertical_spacing 0.2 Number V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mhorizontal_spacing: Specifies the space between horizontally adjacent elements in the grid.[0m [1;31m Default value is set conservatively to avoid overlap of subplots.[0m [1;34mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;34m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;34m for nested data containers.[0m [1;31mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;31m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;34mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;31mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;34mvertical_spacing: Specifies the space between vertically adjacent elements in the grid.[0m [1;34m Default value is set conservatively to avoid overlap of subplots.[0m

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Number horizontal_spacing (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=0.5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Specifies the space between horizontally adjacent elements in the grid. Default value is set conservatively to avoid overlap of subplots.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param Number vertical_spacing (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=0.2, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Specifies the space between vertically adjacent elements in the grid. Default value is set conservatively to avoid overlap of subplots.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.05, 0.05, 0.95, 0.95), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e8177e0>Â¶
get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e817940>Â¶
grid_situate(subplots, current_idx, layout_type, subgrid_width)[source]Â¶

Situate the current AdjointLayoutPlot in a LayoutPlot. The LayoutPlot specifies a layout_type into which the AdjointLayoutPlot must be embedded. This enclosing layout is guaranteed to have enough cells to display all the views.

Based on this enforced layout format, a starting index supplied by LayoutPlot (indexing into a large gridspec arrangement) is updated to the appropriate embedded value. It will also return a list of gridspec indices associated with the all the required layout axes.

inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e817890>Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e817730>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e8176d8>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_handles(axis, view, key, ranges=None)[source]Â¶

Should be called by the update_frame class to update any handles on the plot.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.plot.Plot(figure=None, axis=None, dimensions=None, layout_dimensions=None, subplots=None, uniform=True, keys=None, subplot=False, **params)[source]Â¶

Bases: param.parameterized.Parameterized

params(figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

A Plot object returns either a matplotlib figure object (when called or indexed) or a matplotlib animation object as appropriate. Plots take element objects such as Matrix, Contours or Points as inputs and plots them in the appropriate format. As views may vary over time, all plots support animation via the anim() method.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW show_frame True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;31m for nested data containers.[0m [1;34mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;34m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;31mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;31msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;34mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)

The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

raster ModuleÂ¶

class holoviews.plotting.raster.MatrixGridPlot(layout, keys=None, dimensions=None, ranges=None, **params)[source]Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.plot.GridPlot, holoviews.plotting.element.OverlayPlot

params(border=Number, tick_format=String, show_legend=Boolean, apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

MatrixGridPlot evenly spaces out plots of individual projections on a grid, even when they differ in size. Since this class uses a single axis to generate all the individual plots it is much faster than the equivalent using subplots.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.

The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.

Aggregate border as a fraction of total plot size.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31maspect: The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may[0m [1;31m select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may[0m [1;31m be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display[0m [1;31m the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and[0m [1;31m ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in[0m [1;31m matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.[0m [1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;31m for nested data containers.[0m [1;34mnormalize_individually: < No docstring available >[0m [1;31morientation: The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not[0m [1;31m always be respected by all plots but should be respected by[0m [1;31m adjoined plots when appropriate.[0m [1;34mprojection: The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to[0m [1;34m 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.[0m [1;31mrescale_individually: Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.[0m [1;34mshow_frame: Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.[0m [1;31mshow_grid: Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.[0m [1;34mshow_title: Whether to display the plot title.[0m [1;31mshow_values: Whether to annotate the values when displaying a HeatMap.[0m [1;34mshow_xaxis: Whether and where to display the xaxis.[0m [1;31mshow_yaxis: Whether and where to display the yaxis.[0m [1;34msize: Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.[0m [1;31mtitle_format: The formatting string for the title of this plot.[0m [1;34mxticks: Number of ticks along the x-axis.[0m [1;31myticks: Number of ticks along the y-axis.[0m

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The aspect ratio mode of the plot. By default, a plot may select its own appropriate aspect ratio but sometimes it may be necessary to force a square aspect ratio (e.g. to display the plot as an element of a grid). The modes ‘auto’ and ‘equal’ correspond to the axis modes of the same name in matplotlib, a numeric value may also be passed.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.

param Boolean normalize_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)

param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param Boolean show_values (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to annotate the values when displaying a HeatMap.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e2ba730>Â¶
get_extents(view, ranges)Â¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e2ba8e8>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e2ba5d0>Â¶
message(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e2ba788>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e2baa48>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

seaborn ModuleÂ¶

class holoviews.plotting.seaborn.BivariatePlot(element, keys=None, ranges=None, dimensions=None, overlaid=False, cyclic_index=0, zorder=0, **params)[source]Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.seaborn.FullRedrawPlot

params(joint=Boolean, apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

Bivariate plot visualizes two-dimensional kernel density estimates using the Seaborn kdeplot function. Additionally, by enabling the joint option, the marginals distributions can be plotted alongside each axis (does not animate or compose).

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.

The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Aspect ratio defaults to square, ‘equal’ or numeric values are also supported.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Enables the axis grid.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Enables computing the plot bounds from the data itself. Disabled by default since data is often preprocessed, before display, changing the bounds.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Boolean joint (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to visualize the kernel density estimate with marginal distributions along each axis. Does not animate or compose when enabled.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)

Whether and where to display the yaxis.

The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

class holoviews.plotting.seaborn.DistributionPlot(element, keys=None, ranges=None, dimensions=None, overlaid=False, cyclic_index=0, zorder=0, **params)[source]Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.seaborn.FullRedrawPlot

params(apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

DistributionPlot visualizes Distribution Views using the Seaborn distplot function. This allows visualizing a 1D array as a histogram, kernel density estimate, or rugplot.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Enables computing the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;34m Disabled by default since data is often preprocessed,[0m [1;34m before display, changing the bounds.[0m [1;31maspect: Aspect ratio defaults to square, ‘equal’ or numeric values[0m [1;31m are also supported.[0m [1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Disabled by default for clarity.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Aspect ratio defaults to square, ‘equal’ or numeric values are also supported.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Enables the axis grid.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Enables computing the plot bounds from the data itself. Disabled by default since data is often preprocessed, before display, changing the bounds.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.
param Boolean rescale_individually (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=False, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.
param Boolean show_title (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to display the plot title.
param NumericTuple figure_size (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(4, 4), instantiate=False, length=2, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The matplotlib figure size in inches.
param Integer size (allow_None=False, bounds=(1, 100), constant=False, default=100, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Size relative to the supplied figure size in percent.
param ObjectSelector show_yaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=left, instantiate=False, objects=[‘left’, ‘right’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e22dcb0>Â¶
get_extents(view, ranges)Â¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e22dc00>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e22daa0>Â¶
message(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e22daf8>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e22dd08>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.seaborn.FullRedrawPlot(element, keys=None, ranges=None, dimensions=None, overlaid=False, cyclic_index=0, zorder=0, **params)[source]Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.element.ElementPlot

params(apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

FullRedrawPlot provides an abstract baseclass, defining an update_frame method, which completely wipes the axis and redraws the plot.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

class holoviews.plotting.seaborn.RegressionPlot(element, keys=None, ranges=None, dimensions=None, overlaid=False, cyclic_index=0, zorder=0, **params)[source]Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.seaborn.FullRedrawPlot

params(apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

RegressionPlot visualizes Regression Views using the seaborn regplot interface, allowing the user to perform and plot linear regressions on a set of scatter points. Parameters to the replot function can be supplied via the opts magic.

anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.

force_new_dynamic_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e22dd08>Â¶
get_extents(view, ranges)Â¶

Gets the extents for the axes from the current View. The globally computed ranges can optionally override the extents.

get_param_values(onlychanged=False)Â¶

Return a list of name,value pairs for all Parameters of this object.

If onlychanged is True, will only return values that are not equal to the default value.

get_value_generator = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e22daf8>Â¶
inspect_value = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e22dba8>Â¶
message(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a message.

classmethod params(parameter_name=None)Â¶

Return the Parameters of this class as the dictionary {name: parameter_object}

Includes Parameters from this class and its superclasses.

classmethod print_param_defaults()Â¶

Print the default values of all cls’s Parameters.

print_param_values()Â¶

Print the values of all this object’s Parameters.

script_repr(imports=, []prefix=' ')Â¶

Variant of __repr__ designed for generating a runnable script.

classmethod set_default(param_name, value)Â¶

Set the default value of param_name.

Equivalent to setting param_name on the class.

set_dynamic_time_fn = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e22daa0>Â¶
set_param = <functools.partial object at 0x2b153e22dc58>Â¶
state_pop()Â¶

Restore the most recently saved state.

See state_push() for more details.

state_push()Â¶

Save this instance’s state.

For Parameterized instances, this includes the state of dynamically generated values.

Subclasses that maintain short-term state should additionally save and restore that state using state_push() and state_pop().

Generally, this method is used by operations that need to test something without permanently altering the objects’ state.

update_frame(key, ranges=None)Â¶

Set the plot(s) to the given frame number. Operates by manipulating the matplotlib objects held in the self._handles dictionary.

If n is greater than the number of available frames, update using the last available frame.

verbose(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a verbose message.

warning(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a warning, unless module variable warnings_as_exceptions is True, then raise an Exception containing the arguments.

class holoviews.plotting.seaborn.SNSFramePlot(view, **params)[source]Â¶

Bases: holoviews.plotting.pandas.DFrameViewPlot

params(plot_type=ObjectSelector, apply_databounds=Boolean, aspect=Parameter, orientation=ObjectSelector, rescale_individually=Boolean, show_grid=Boolean, show_xaxis=ObjectSelector, show_yaxis=ObjectSelector, xticks=Integer, yticks=Integer, figure_bounds=NumericTuple, figure_size=NumericTuple, finalize_hooks=HookList, normalize=Boolean, projection=ObjectSelector, show_frame=Boolean, show_title=Boolean, size=Integer, title_format=String, name=String)

SNSFramePlot takes an SNSFrame as input and plots the contained data using the set plot_type. This largely mirrors the way DFramePlot works, however, since most Seaborn plot types plot one dimension against another it uses the x and y parameters, which can be set on the SNSFrame.

[0m [1;31mParameters changed from their default values are marked in red.[0m [1;36mSoft bound values are marked in cyan.[0m C/V= Constant/Variable, RO/RW = ReadOnly/ReadWrite, AN=Allow None

[1;34mName Value Type Bounds Mode [0m

apply_databounds True Boolean (0, 1) V RW aspect ‘square’ Parameter V RW figure_bounds (0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85) NumericTuple V RW figure_size (4, 4) NumericTuple V RW finalize_hooks [] HookList (0, None) V RW normalize True Boolean (0, 1) V RW orientation ‘horizontal’ ObjectSelector V RW plot_type ‘scatter_matrix’ ObjectSelector V RW projection None ObjectSelector V RW rescale_individually False Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_frame True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_grid True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_title True Boolean (0, 1) V RW show_xaxis ‘bottom’ ObjectSelector V RW show_yaxis ‘left’ ObjectSelector V RW size 100 Integer (1, 100) V RW title_format ‘{label} {value}’ String V RW xticks 5 Integer V RW yticks 5 Integer V RW

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mapply_databounds: Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.[0m [1;31maspect: Aspect ratio defaults to square, ‘equal’ or numeric values[0m [1;31m are also supported.[0m [1;34mfigure_bounds: The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form[0m [1;34m (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border[0m [1;34m around the subplots.[0m [1;31mfigure_size: The matplotlib figure size in inches.[0m [1;34mfinalize_hooks: Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis.[0m [1;34m The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the[0m [1;34m displayed object.[0m [1;31mnormalize: Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level[0m [1;31m of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels[0m [1;31m for nested data containers.[0m [1;34morientation: The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not[0m [1;34m always be respected by all plots but should be respected by[0m [1;34m adjoined plots when appropriate.[0m [1;31mplot_type: Selects which Seaborn plot type to use, when visualizing the[0m [1;31m SNSFrame. param Boolean normalize (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute ranges across all Elements at this level of plotting. Allows selecting normalization at different levels for nested data containers.
param Integer xticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the x-axis.
param Boolean show_frame (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether or not to show a complete frame around the plot.
param ObjectSelector show_xaxis (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=bottom, instantiate=False, objects=[‘top’, ‘bottom’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether and where to display the xaxis.
param ObjectSelector plot_type (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=scatter_matrix, instantiate=False, objects=[‘interact’, ‘regplot’, ‘lmplot’, ‘corrplot’, ‘plot’, ‘boxplot’, ‘hist’, ‘scatter_matrix’, ‘autocorrelation_plot’, ‘pairgrid’, ‘facetgrid’, ‘pairplot’, ‘violinplot’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Selects which Seaborn plot type to use, when visualizing the SNSFrame. The options that can be passed to the plot_type are defined in dframe_options.
param ObjectSelector orientation (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=horizontal, instantiate=False, objects=[‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The orientation of the plot. Note that this parameter may not always be respected by all plots but should be respected by adjoined plots when appropriate.
param Parameter aspect (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=square, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Aspect ratio defaults to square, ‘equal’ or numeric values are also supported.
param Boolean show_grid (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to show a Cartesian grid on the plot.
param Boolean apply_databounds (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, 1), constant=False, default=True, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Whether to compute the plot bounds from the data itself.
param NumericTuple figure_bounds (allow_None=False, constant=False, default=(0.15, 0.15, 0.85, 0.85), instantiate=False, length=4, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The bounds of the figure as a 4-tuple of the form (left, bottom, right, top), defining the size of the border around the subplots.
param Integer yticks (allow_None=False, bounds=None, constant=False, default=5, inclusive_bounds=(True, True), instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False, time_dependent=False, time_fn=<Time Time00001>)
Number of ticks along the y-axis.
param String title_format (allow_None=False, constant=False, default={label} {value}, instantiate=False, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The formatting string for the title of this plot.

Whether to use redraw the axes per map or per element.
param HookList finalize_hooks (allow_None=False, bounds=(0, None), constant=False, default=[], instantiate=True, pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
Optional list of hooks called when finalizing an axis. The hook is passed the full set of plot handles and the displayed object.

Whether and where to display the yaxis.
param ObjectSelector projection (allow_None=None, check_on_set=True, compute_default_fn=None, constant=False, default=None, instantiate=False, objects=[‘3d’, ‘polar’, None], pickle_default_value=True, precedence=None, readonly=False)
The projection of the plot axis, default of None is equivalent to 2D plot, 3D and polar plots are also supported.
anim(start=0, stop=None, fps=30)Â¶

Method to return an Matplotlib animation. The start and stop frames may be specified as well as the fps.

compute_ranges(obj, key, ranges)Â¶

Given an object, a specific key and the normalization options this method will find the specified normalization options on the appropriate OptionTree, group the elements according to the selected normalization option (i.e. either per frame or over the whole animation) and finally compute the dimension ranges in each group. The new set of ranges is returned.

debug(*args)Â¶

Print the arguments as a debugging statement.

defaults()Â¶

Return {parameter_name:parameter.default} for all non-constant Parameters.

Note that a Parameter for which instantiate==True has its default instantiated.
